parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: To sink, set (as the sun). Or dumi doo'-mee prolonged forms of an obsolete primary duo doo'-o to go down.
All, the whole, altogether. Absolutely all or every one.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: To be weak (physically: then morally), To be sick. From asthenes; to be feeble.
Various, of different colors, diverse, various. Of uncertain derivation; motley, i.e. Various in character.
A disease, malady, sickness. Of uncertain affinity; a malady.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: A primary verb; properly, to lead; by implication, to bring, drive, go, pass, or induce.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To put, place upon, lay on; I add, give in addition. From epi and tithemi; to impose.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Each (of more than two), every one. As if a superlative of hekas; each or every.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From the same as therapon; to wait upon menially, i.e. to adore, or to relieve.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
